byline.original: By BROOKS BARNES and CARA BUCKLEY

abstract: Release of Nate Parker film The Birth of a Nation, which he wrote, directed and stars in, has been clouded by disclosure of details surrounding 17-year-old case in which he was accused and acquitted of raping fellow student while he was at Pennsylvania State University; revelation of details of case, including fact that accuser committed suicide in 2012, has put studio Fox Searchlight on defensive.
lead_paragraph: It has become clouded by a nearly two-decade-old case in which Mr. Parker was accused, and later acquitted, of raping a fellow student while at Penn State.
snippet: It has become clouded by a nearly two-decade-old case in which Mr. Parker was accused, and later acquitted, of raping a fellow student while at Penn State....

headline.main: ‘The Birth of a Nation,’ Nate Parker’s Heralded Film, Is Now Cloaked in Controversy
headline.print_headline: Criminal Case Trails Director and His Film
